page.title: 11 INCINERATOR
page.content: The Baldovie Incineration Plant opened in February 1979 is on the east side of the city of Dundee.It has two 7 tonnes/h furnaces each equipped with Heenan-Nichols rocking grates giving a total treatment capacity of 14 tonnes/h.The water used for gas cooling is drawn from the nearby Dighty Burn and is stored in two concrete settling tanks beneath the hall floor.Normal furnace operating temperature is approx.900 degrees centigrade to 1100 degrees centigrade and the exhaust bases are cooled in a water spray cooling tower to a temperature of 300 degrees centigrade before passing through an electorised precipitator which cleans the gases before they are exhausted to atmosphere through the 70m high chimney.
